The coil rotates uniformly around the symmetry axis $OO'$.
The timing starts when the coil plane passes through the neutral plane.
The induced electromotive force (EMF) in the coil is given by $E = nB \cdot A \cdot \omega \cdot \sin(\omega t)$.
The area of the coil is $A = l_{AB} \cdot l_{BC} = 0.2 \mathrm{m} \cdot 0.5 \mathrm{m} = 0.1 \mathrm{m}^2$.

Substitute the values into the EMF formula: $E = nB \cdot A \cdot \omega \cdot \sin(\omega t) = 100 \cdot 0.1 \mathrm{T} \cdot 0.1 \mathrm{m}^2 \cdot 100\pi \mathrm{rad/s} \cdot \sin(100\pi t) = 10 \cdot 100\pi \cdot \sin(100\pi t) = 1000\pi \cdot \sin(100\pi t) \mathrm{V}$.
The magnitude of the induced electromotive force is $314\sin(100\pi t) \mathrm{V}$.
